definitions.definition: To hesitate or be reluctant to act due to considerations of conscience or expedience .
examples: They wouldn't scruple to cheat us if given the opportunity.

definitions.definition: To excite scruples in; to cause to scruple.
To regard with suspicion ; to question .
To question the truth of (a fact, etc.); to doubt ; to hesitate to believe , to question.
examples: I do not scruple to admit that all the Earth seeth but only half of the Moon.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To hesitate or be reluctant to act due to considerations of conscience or expedience .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To excite scruples in; to cause to scruple.
( transitive ) To regard with suspicion ; to question .
( intransitive , obsolete ) To question the truth of (a fact, etc.); to doubt ; to hesitate to believe , to question.
